item.description:
about me

I am currently finishing my PhD in public health, economics, and decision science at the University of Sheffield, UK. In my research, I try to figure out how to value the things that are invaluable (health, well-being, life, etc). I also sometimes develop health economic models or interactive user interfaces.

Originally, my background was in clinical medicine. I am a physician by training, with a doctoral degree in medicine from the Institute for Health Systems Research, University of Witten/Herdecke, Germany. I also hold a Research Master’s degree in health sciences from Maastricht University, the Netherlands.

#OpenScience
